item.title: Route
item.description: .marker { display: block; border: none; border-radius: 50%; cursor: pointer; padding: 0; } .mapboxgl-popup { max-width: 400px; font: 16px 'Lora', serif; } .

item.title: Crew
item.description: We’re a family of five travelling around the world in a Catana 401 named Vite & Rêves. You can translate this name as Fast & Dreams, but it’s also pronounced the same way as ‘Vis tes rêves’ — Live your dreams.

item.title: Vite & Rêves
item.description: Sailing the Catana 401 shows her to be very fast with frank accelerations. She is easy to handle, both under sail and with motors.

item.title: 2019-10-13 Laundry day
item.description: We found a laundromat and made the most of it thanks to laundromat regular Pascuale

item.title: 2019-10-12 Across the Adriatic
item.description: We cross the Adriatic Sea to Italy on a fast clip.

item.title: 2019-10-11 Resting day
item.description: We took a day of rest and provisioning in Palaiokastrita before our crossing to Italy

item.title: 2019-10-10 Front surfing
item.description: We anchored too close to another boat and had to leave for Corfu. The day was sharply divided in a nice spinnaker sail and an exhilarating surf down thunderstorm waves.

item.title: 2019-10-09 Making water
item.description: A windless day saw us motoring all the way to Antipaxoi island where we had to try a few bays before finding one that would hold us safely.

item.title: 2019-10-08 In Odysseus' footsteps
item.description: We discovered the palace of Odysseus on the island of Ithaki after a very early forced start in the morning.

item.title: 2019-10-07 Thunderstuck
item.description: We got stuck in Agios Nikolaos. There were thunderstorms all around us all day long. It rained. Our berth became untenable due te the heavy swell.

item.title: 2019-10-06 Shipwreck beach
item.description: No visit to Zakynthos would be complete without a stop at Shipwreck Beach. Getting away from there proved… challenging.

item.title: 2019-10-05 A fast run
item.description: A close-hauled sail took us to Zakythos.

item.title: 2019-10-04 Deserted Katakolo
item.description: We are stuck for a day in the eery town of Katakolo. We did meet a nice local who sold us vegetables straight from his garden.

item.title: 2019-10-02 A bit of everything
item.description: We encountered several waterspouts on the way to Zakynthos. Due to a 360 degree wind shift, we ended up in Katakolo.

item.title: 2019-10-02 On achieving calm
item.description: After a tricky start, we ended up in the delightful, quiet bay of Panagoula.

item.title: 2019-10-01 Tight sailing
item.description: We ended up in Pylos but there was no room for us in the marina.

item.title: 2019-09-30 Koroni castle
item.description: We visited the huge castle of Koroni.

item.title: 2019-09-29 No time to waste
item.description: We saw a dolphin on the way to Koroni.

item.title: 2019-09-28 Wing on wing
item.description: We set sail for the very relaxed village of Geralimena.

item.title: 2019-09-27 Rounding cape Maleas
item.description: We rounded cape Maleas and dropped anchor at Elafonisos beach.

item.title: Alle begin is moeilijk
item.description: Het is al ruim een week geleden dat we startten aan dit zotte avontuur. De halve wereld rond, met ons vijven, op onze catamaran ‘Vite & Rêves’.

item.title: 2019-09-26 Uncooperative winds
item.description: We set sail for the island of Kythira but ended up in the tiny industrial port of Velanidia.

item.title: 2019-09-25 Medieval Monemvasia
item.description: We visited the very beautiful medieval city of Monemvasia.

item.title: 2019-09-24 Gale sailing
item.description: We set sail for Monemvasia and arrived in a Gale, just before a thunderstorm broke loose.

item.title: 2019-09-23 Relaxing at Vlychada Bay
item.description: Vlychada bay was so nice we decided to stay for a day.

item.title: 2019-09-22 No wind
item.description: We set sail for Monemvasia but didn’t make it because the wind died completely. We discovered a paradisiacal bay though!

item.title: 2019-09-21 Kissed the quay
item.description: The wind picked up so much that our anchor didn’t hold. We reanchored and visited Vlychos beach.

item.title: 2019-09-20 A fond farewell
item.description: We maved the Vite & Rêves to the lovely Hydra port and said goodbye to the Parents.

item.title: 2019-09-19 Lazy line troubles
item.description: A rocky start turned into a great sailing day.

item.title: 2019-09-18 Shopping and provisioning
item.description: We moved the boat to Lavrion port and went Ikea shopping.

item.title: 2019-09-17 Started in Lavrion
item.description: We’re getting ready to leave for our world trip. We took 5 small suitcases and 2 big ones of clothes and stuff, 3 kids and 2 Parents with us. The Parents will travel back at the end of the week.

item.title: 2019-08-31 We have a boat!
item.description: We bought a boat and did a shake-down cruise in August. It was glorious!
